Name: Autopsy
Description: Autopsy is a digital forensics platform and graphical interface to The Sleuth Kit and other digital forensics tools. It is used by law enforcement, military, and corporate examiners to investigate what happened on a computer.
HTU: Install Autopsy, create a new case, add data sources (disk images, local disks), and start analyzing the data.

Name: FTK Imager
Description: FTK Imager is a data preview and imaging tool that lets you quickly assess electronic evidence to determine if further analysis with a forensic tool such as FTK is warranted.
HTU: Download and install FTK Imager, create an image of the drive or folder you want to examine, and start the analysis process.

Name: Sleuth Kit
Description: The Sleuth Kit (TSK) is a library and collection of command-line digital forensics tools that allow you to investigate volume and file system data.
HTU: Install The Sleuth Kit, use the command-line tools to analyze disk images, and interpret the output to investigate the data.

Name: MiniTool Power Data Recovery
Description: MiniTool Power Data Recovery is a free data recovery software for Windows that allows users to recover lost, deleted, or corrupted files from various storage devices.
HTU: Install Autopsy, create a new case, add data sources (disk images, local disks), and start analyzing the data.

Name: ExifTool
Description: ExifTool is a platform-independent Perl library plus a command-line application for reading, writing, and editing meta information in a wide variety of files.
HTU: Download and install ExifTool, run the command-line tool with the desired options to read or modify metadata in files.
